solution_line_template: If she changes the box weekly, then in {total_days} days, she will change the box {total_days}/{days_per_week}=<<{total_days}/{days_per_week}={num_changes}>>{num_changes} times.

At {litter_per_change} pounds of litter for every box change, she will require {num_changes}*{litter_per_change}=<<{num_changes}*{litter_per_change}={total_litter_pounds}>>{total_litter_pounds} pounds of cat litter in 210 days.

If she buys {container_size}-pound containers, then for {total_litter_pounds} pounds she will need to buy {total_litter_pounds}/{container_size}=<<{total_litter_pounds}/{container_size}={num_containers}>>{num_containers} containers of litter.
At ${cost_per_container} per container, to buy enough cat litter for 210 days, it will cost {num_containers} * ${cost_per_container} = ${total_cost}
